§7Corner Quarants uses basically 4 separate spheres at the corners
§7of the rectangle area defined by the center and the margin distance.
§7The corner quadrants was the old behavior, and it gets derpy (especially on the
§7cardinal sides) if the margin increases to more than a few blocks.
§7The new default is not using the corner quadrants anymore,
§7but instead to kind of "slide the sphere around the margin perimeter"
§7to create the final shape.

{DAY_1} starts the day counter from 1, {DAY} starts from 0.

This enables the Beacon Range renderer t:
This enables the Beacon Range renderer to update automatically
when block or chunk change packets are received.
Those updates can have a performance impact if tons of blocks are changing often.
You can toggle off/on the renderer to update to those changes manually.
If enabled, then the Biome Border Overla:
If enabled, then the Biome Border Overlay will use
the same color for all biomes. This can look "less messy"
when the adjacent biome's colors and lines aren't blending
into a huge mess of colors.
Don't clear the stored world seed when j:
Don't clear the stored world seed when just changing dimensions.
Some mods may use per-dimension seeds, so you may need to change
this in case the different dimensions on your server/mod pack
have different world seeds.
If enabled, then the Light Level overlay:
If enabled, then the Light Level overlay will be
automatically raised to render on top of the block's shape.
§6Note: This will make the overlay also render
§6on top of things like slabs, where mobs will not be able to spawn,
§6unless you turn on the collision check option as well.

If enabled, then the Light Level overlay is not rendered
if there is any block with a collision box in the way.
§6Note: This is not a proper check for spawnability!
§6This would omit any block even partially sticking into the lower spawn block!
§6For example open trapdoors or doors would prevent the overlay from showing.

If enabled, then the Light Level overlay
will be rendered through blocks
Should the Light Level Overlay skip the:
Should the Light Level Overlay skip the spawnability
check of the block below. This would make the
overlay also appear on top of slabs and glass etc.
Should the light level overlay render un: Should the light level overlay render under water

The main rendering toggle for all MiniHUD rendering,
including the info lines AND all the overlay renderers
